2EB7FBFE24C1431AAF48F7B3BF89D192.description: Write routinely in a genre over extended time frames to engage in the writing process (planning, drafting, editing, revising, publishing) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes and audiences.

904AC23EE476480BAA6A0F2B0E0E8FFF.description: Write routinely over shorter time frames using a variety of writing opportunities (e.g., journal entry, letter, graphic organizer) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes and audiences.

F2C03E08BFBB49DE97B286F38E48D317.description: Analyze mentor texts to support knowledge of different types of thinking and writing (e.g., analyze newspaper editorials to explore the way the author developed the argument, reflective essays, investigation).

A19167B867014B9791E76B46B9853A23.description: Provide a list of sources that contributed to the content within a writing piece.

3E8B5430389D4B3C8AE5D8C6113EAD61.description: Take brief notes and categorize relevant information (e.g., graphic organizers, notes, labeling, listing) from sources.

B70ED17798DA43819D0F007AAF8CEFFD.description: Identify key details from an informational text that are relevant to the specific topic.

DCF8ECCDEB3C4511B64EE26E16CF5607.description: Gather relevant information (e.g., highlight in text, quote or paraphrase from text or discussion) from print and/or digital sources.

7D267E3CD00F45C89289EE13584624E4.description: Recall relevant information from experiences for use in writing.

4DE7EC5AD55E4A428AED002BA5FEF756.description: Build knowledge on topics through continued engagement in research investigation.

18253A793FC04ACBB6452467F18E68CD.description: Follow steps to engage in a short research project (e.g., determine topic, generate research questions, locate information on a topic, organize information related to the topic, draft a permanent product).

A161BEFF9166401CB0C6039ED5593C1E.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

E102E416268941A39FD6C9A814322F29.description: With guidance and support from adults, use technology to publish writing (e.g., post finished writing product on the Web, use software to display writing with accompanying illustration).

73AD8C0F18224818BE1B36854D8F70F8.description: With guidance and support from adults, use technology to produce writing (e.g., use the Internet to gather information, word processing to generate and collaborate on writing).

BADEE4AACF8D4BEC9286069C9EAD1FC5.description: With guidance and support from peers and adults, strengthen writing by editing (e.g., capitalization, spelling, punctuation).

3F37BDB33FBB4949B6CF16D3B9ECAC9C.description: With guidance and support from peers and adults, strengthen writing by revising for clarity of meaning (e.g., review product, strengthening story, adding precise language).

C460729E335E46458B56ED417CB66348.description: With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop a plan for writing that is appropriate to the topic, task and purpose.

42588C4E35BD41D1B400DB1478E4F6F9.description: Produce a clear, coherent draft (e.g., select/generate responses to form paragraph/essay) that is appropriate to the specific task, purpose and audience for use in developing a permanent product.

3567CB954A0241D4A3AD597125ED0AE8.description: Provide a conclusion (concluding sentence, paragraph or extended ending) that follows from the narrated experiences or events.

A54BC0C6298E4C868418DBB22A2ED244.description: Use concrete words and phrases and sensory details to convey experiences and events.

C4341C53AEB74FAEAFB36AD590EAEA34.description: Use a variety of transitional words and phrases to manage the sequence of events.

EA11F2D9068C4205BCF06F15C571DB82.description: When appropriate, use dialogue and description to develop experiences and events or show the responses of characters to situations.

12BC4365610142FEA82CC7F10C857C73.description: Sequence events in writing that unfold naturally.

7B5581231CC04D6B8347CD80D2104BAC.description: Orient the reader by setting up the context for the story and introducing a narrator and/or characters.

93B93793737C413E960A88A33722D9A6.description: Provide a concluding statement or section to support the information presented.

05CF6F4D8DE24D45BC3E2FB8AFCCE853.description: Use increasingly precise language and domain-specific vocabulary over time to inform about or explain a variety of topics.

943F4634CFB34BB387AF9D2984C1A535.description: Link ideas within categories of information, appropriately using words and phrases (e.g., another, for example, also, because).

A3E7A12F591F443F956DD425309DE667.description: Include formatting (e.g., headings), illustrations and multimedia when appropriate to convey information about the topic.

1A27CFE431374E3F99D5EAF0E937527D.description: Develop the topic (add additional information related to the topic) with relevant facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations or other information and examples related to the topic.

33589BEF31D14A01A01E1F3FEC400A12.description: Introduce a topic clearly and group related information in paragraphs and sections.

2340268162FD444E8896D0F1E4E93FCF.description: Provide a concluding statement or section related to the opinion presented.

D7E3368D85384675A19C937E73182735.description: Use transitional words and phrases appropriately to link opinion and reasons.

A1B36758F8684CD2BAE416276233C5B3.description: Create an organizational structure that lists reasons in a logical order.

3D2D93A1AFBE46FBADC9716B6608041C.description: Provide reasons that include relevant facts and details that support a stated opinion.

E21E55D3D0EB42D0B6D6908EBF660BEE.description: Introduce the topic or text within persuasive writing by stating an opinion.

C7729932EE2344FAB1242B4B266AB915.description: Use formal English when appropriate to task and situation.

1C61FD7FCE524C8C8C643E24976001B5.description: Differentiate between contexts that call for formal English (e.g., presenting ideas) and situations where informal discourse is appropriate (e.g., small group discussions).

140BACE496E248CAB0CC162669809A88.description: Add audio recordings and visual displays to presentations when appropriate to enhance the development of main ideas or themes.

413C8A1F2A754BF987EE85AB9FFCB767.description: Elaborate on each fact or opinion given in support of a claim with relevant details.

3AD840810F654716996B6B45022F54BC.description: Report on a topic, story or claim with a logical sequence of ideas, appropriate facts and relevant, descriptive details.

8CBE4D2865A24740806A60389F219891.description: Identify the reasons and evidence a speaker provides to support particular points.

54068846190644B69822E93DA783AE49.description: Paraphrase portions of a text read aloud or information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively and orally.

8C31BFB3E7684149BCE5B174EA7C56EF.description: Review the key ideas expressed within a collaborative discussion.

714CBCE9663644FB8C8B1BDF6B77C8C5.description: Make appropriate comments that contribute to a collaborative discussion.

E6F35D18227D45D2B2B5D24EF385ABBA.description: Ask questions to check understanding of information presented in collaborative discussions.

646119AAA57348D09A197258E6FF992B.description: Provide evidence of being prepared for discussions on a topic or text through appropriate statements made during discussion.

331A331346934D4686603A596DF23006.description: Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition.

A7C99336B671407FABEA7F02BC2F91BC.description: Read text (including prose and poetry) with accuracy, appropriate rate and expression (when applicable) on successive readings.

4AC0A503EB2E43DBBAB8ED23D6D6205E.description: Practice self-monitoring strategies to aid comprehension (e.g., reread, use visuals or cueing system, self-correct, ask questions, confirm predictions).

037D998C3241414EA3137C874476403A.description: Identify grade-level words with accuracy and on successive attempts.

2F80C7ABD0134F808083D2D7FD3E5235.description: Recognize and accurately use letter-sound correspondences, syllabication patterns and morphology (e.g., affixes) to identify and/or read multisyllabic words.

DF53E8B898F1411B830EFF5A0A39AB86.description: Read or listen to and recount stories, dramas, poetry and other types of text -- including adapted text -- of increasing complexity over time for a variety of purposes.

DBB1A837BFE64B1C90FFDF2E521AF19B.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

A2D144C26E9B448183B29EC3A597CE1B.description: Compare the treatment of patterns of events (e.g., the quest) in stories, myths and traditional literature from different cultures.

F57F385132AB40D3A518AC363A1CF8E8.description: Compare the treatment of similar themes and topics (e.g., opposition of good and evil) in stories, myths and traditional literature from different cultures.

5881089861054FBF8F997F5992A802F1.description: Make connections between the text of a play and the oral representations, referring back to text/illustrations to support answer.

0C32799CB470448ABFB13866FB59F09D.description: Make connections between the text of a story and the visual representations, referring back to text/illustrations to support answer.

064756FF6429421CBD3557A45A0A8F71.description: Use evidence from both the text version and oral or visual presentation of the same text to support inferences, opinions and conclusions.

EA62FB1F68EF4FCB8B9FF3F41ECB955D.description: Compare the point of view from which different stories are narrated, including the difference between first- and third-person narrations.

910D1C16E6A64DDEB0FA2102D32DA07A.description: Determine the authors point of view (first- or third-person) in a second story.

E8B526DFE80E495DBEE009358AE5C14C.description: Determine the authors point of view (first- or third-person) in one story.

22924B424A0345B582DB39F9254D2E59.description: Identify how the structure of a play is different than the structure of a story (e.g., text includes props; dialogue without quotation marks acts/scenes instead of chapter).

67E6E9EF2E194F5FA7C1DE2F79947723.description: Identify how the structure of a poem is different than a story (e.g., identify rhyme, shorter than stories; stanza instead of paragraph).

58C98F71CF544AA2B4930AD7709794B7.description: Determine the meaning of general academic and literary-specific words and phrases in increasingly complex text over time.

6FBB464BC6344B998DDC77BD6B43B188.description: Refer to text information that relates to one specific aspect of either the relationship between characters, setting, events or conflicts.

0BC880BE8FE143FAA5F08A5A653110EC.description: Identify relevant words and phrases throughout the text to determine the theme of a story, drama or poem; refer to text to support answer.

338855E3245840999E22617666E6383E.description: Use information that relates to text organization and story elements in order to summarize a story, poem or drama.

2C128417553B49128BF884379C499139.description: Refer to details and examples in a text that are relevant to drawing basic inferences about a story, poem or drama.

FCB7794250ED42189AC147CD5A5AA1C1.description: Refer to details and examples in a text that are relevant to explaining what the text says explicitly.

DF56F571DF4C441C9DD564B1FB8C35C1.description: Read or listen to and recount self-selected stories, dramas, poetry and other types of increasingly complex text over time.

31D92371324F437C862A35BBE2F653B3.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

4EBCACE529664A4F80BF8BB82786BDD9.description: Identify the most important information about a topic gathered from two texts on the same topic in order to write or speak about the subject knowledgeably.

C812201D916548CCB76F5CD9607ABBA1.description: Report out about two or more texts on the same self-selected topic.

FF04D685CFDA42DF949C032B2D691758.description: Identify and use the most relevant information from two texts to write or speak about various aspects of a specific topic.

D9C721C0F3944338BC893D7AB33C4BC0.description: Use two texts to gather different types of information relevant to a specific topic.

60A650DD0DA94C5D8D5A30EC23FA2DFB.description: Identify facts and examples that an author uses to support a specific point or argument in an informational text.

CAE2E51950D548608AFABB4769F5D7CC.description: Summarize information presented visually, orally or quantitatively (e.g., in charts, graphs, diagrams, time lines, animations or interactive elements on Web pages) and explain how the information contributes to an understanding of the text in which it appears.

9E108799E3034869BE844A88CF8686EB.description: Identify how the information presented visually, orally or quantitatively is relevant to the corresponding text information.

2A6E884673BF48A5993B0AE6D56EE94A.description: Identify relevant information presented visually, orally or quantitatively (e.g., in charts, graphs, diagrams, time lines, animations or interactive elements on Web pages) to answer questions.

42461843206A4C318DBC9178858A1A79.description: Compare and contrast a firsthand and secondhand account of the same event or topic.

98FC6367A9E24A26BBA19C2B4F36CF52.description: Determine if information in a text is firsthand or secondhand.

35F478F6E61A40E5A6F0B30B25832AFF.description: Identify the overall structure of a complete text.

073232B1B8864C23B7B65A9FFE82102C.description: Identify the specific structure (e.g., chronology, comparison, cause/effect, problem/solution) of events, ideas, concepts or information in a text excerpt.

8A2919EAF8D64F7D9F4191A6C3E18D52.description: Identify signal words that provide clues in determining the specific text structure of a short, informational text or text excerpt (e.g., description, problem/solution, time/order, compare/contrast, cause/effect, directions).

6C649B680435482085DA3CB8C77C0918.description: Determine the meaning of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases in increasingly complex texts over time.

C6E239E78F314A5B9965F0C3FE47E714.description: Identify specific causes and effects that relate to events, procedures, ideas or concepts in historical, scientific or technical text.

F3750D526EE845D286F9249370B7476D.description: Identify events, procedures, ideas or concepts in a historical, scientific or technical text.

CF105072A5E1405BA0FBFEFDABAE3660.description: Identify how ideas are organized to summarize the text.

49D66432A13E4E96AB625410AEE539EE.description: Identify supporting details of an informational text.

700780A98B78491BAC15F8819D8F48CF.description: Determine the main idea of an informational text.

1E07DB9F1F204C50BBF7AC6786603D49.description: Refer to details and examples in a text that are relevant to drawing basic inferences from an informational text.

B085D3F95486495B9FD5D2CC0859176B.description: Refer to details and examples in a text that are relevant to explaining what the text says explicitly.

FD44518DCD504867940013E14D62406F.description: Use grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific vocabulary accurately within writing.

DAE01DE021FE4EEE980853BACF2FF271.description: Use general academic and domain-specific words and phrases accurately.

24282C5D71B14A69A140B71F1EE1411E.description: Identify the meaning of common idioms.

2A242A98616D414FABFC1AC308A9FDCC.description: Relate words to words with similar but not identical meanings (synonyms).

291D965C827C4A8592ED6797B0D2E6EE.description: Use a glossary, dictionary or thesaurus to determine the meaning of a word.

8230AE1DA1E14287A453FCC2ADF73D0D.description: Use common grade-appropriate roots and affixes as clues to the meaning of a word.

B61EA8918D3049EDAE6971A90C5B767E.description: Use context to determine the meaning of unknown or multiple-meaning words, or words showing shades of meaning.

4893C86A464E419E80F9E4C366C363EE.description: Choose words and phrases for appropriate effect (e.g., to inform) within writing.

5B186C0D51B14040B88DDF2201C0C1B3.description: Spell words correctly in writing, consulting references as needed.

9708917E5999457CBB18BDE3A1704ECA.description: Use commas and quotation marks in writing.

8110E2ECB6024E1A92FEF642D9326584.description: Recognize and correct fragments and run-on sentences.

EF3D3286902C46899A0DA8BF2DABBD7F.description: Produce simple, compound and complex sentences in writing.

2FA1C8D0397147E0BB11EC0322A2F1B9.description: Use relative pronouns and relative adverbs in writing.
